auth.title: auth
auth.description: Specify the authentication type to use. Values can be `deviceCode` (default) or `password`.

password.title: password
password.description: When using `password` or `certificate` authentication. For `password` authentication you need to pass `username` and `password`. For `certificate` authentication you need to pass `appId`, `tenant`, `certificateBase64Encoded`, and `password` if specified.

username.title: username
username.description: When using `password` authentication, you need to pass the `username` and `password`.

appId.title: appId
appId.description: The `appId` to use for the certificate authentication.

tenant.title: tenant
tenant.description: The `tenant` ID to use for the certificate authentication.

certificateBase64Encoded.title: certificateBase64Encoded
certificateBase64Encoded.description: The `certificateBase64Encoded` base64 string to use for the certificate authentication.

overwriteImages.title: overwriteImages
overwriteImages.description: Specifies if you allow `doctor` to overwrite the images in the SharePoint library that are referenced in the markdown files.

url.title: url
url.description: The URL of the site collection to use.

folder.title: folder
folder.description: The folder location in where you will create your markdown files.

library.title: library
library.description: Specified the library which you want to use in SharePoint to store your referenced images.

webPartTitle.title: The webPartTitle schema
webPartTitle.description: This defined the title of the markdown web part to be created/updated on the page. Default value is: `doctor-placeholder.

pageTemplate.title: pageTemplate
pageTemplate.description: The name of the default page template to use for all the pages.

continueOnError.title: continueOnError
continueOnError.description: Continue when an error occurs during the publishing process.

commandName.title: commandName
commandName.description: In case you want to use the locally installed CLI for Microsoft 365, you can use this flag. By default, it uses the version specified in the doctor tool.

skipExistingPages.title: skipExistingPages
skipExistingPages.description: Will not overwrite pages if they already existed on the site.

retryWhenFailed.title: retryWhenFailed
retryWhenFailed.description: Specifying this flag will retry the command if it failed. In some cases it can be that SharePoint failes to process your request, and this allows you to try again without running the whole flow from scratch.

cleanQuickLaunch.title: cleanQuickLaunch
cleanQuickLaunch.description: Allows you to specify if you want to remove all the navigation elements defined in the QuickLaunch navigation before adding the new navigation structure.

cleanTopNavigation.title: cleanTopNavigation
cleanTopNavigation.description: Allows you to specify if you want to remove all the navigation elements defined in the TopNavigation navigation before adding the new navigation structure.

menu.title: menu
menu.description: Defines the static navigation stucture to get created.

siteDesign.title: siteDesign
siteDesign.description: Defines the design to apply to the site (theme, chrome header and footer).

logo.title: logo
logo.description: Set the logo for the site.

theme.title: theme
theme.description: The name of the SharePoint theme.

chrome.title: Chrome
chrome.description: Site header and footer chrome settings.

headerLayout.title: headerLayout
headerLayout.description: The layout of the chrome header.

logoAlignment.title: logoAlignment
logoAlignment.description: Specify how to align the logo if `extended` header is used.

footerLayout.title: footerLayout
footerLayout.description: The layout of the chrome footer.

disableMegaMenu.title: disableMegaMenu
disableMegaMenu.description: Specify to disable the mega menu. This results in using the cascading navigation (classic experience).

hideTitleInHeader.title: hideTitleInHeader
hideTitleInHeader.description: Specify to hide the site title in the header.

disableFooter.title: disableFooter
disableFooter.description: Specify to disable the footer on the site.

markdown.title: markdown
markdown.description: Special markdown settings of how you want to render you content in SharePoint.

allowHtml.title: allowHtml
allowHtml.description: By default SharePoint renders the HTML. If you set this to `true`, it will allow Doctor to generate the HTML and allows you to make use of all HTML capabilities the tool has to offer.

theme.title: theme
theme.description: Specify the theme to use for the code blocks. Default is `Dark`.
